page.title: 18The Triple Wedding
page.content: Dyserth W.I. re enacted on June 26th,1958,the 1624 "Triple Wedding" when Gwen (widow of Bishop Parry), married Thomas Mostyn squire of Rhyd;Ann her daughter married William Mostyn the heir of Rhyd,and Richard her son,married Marie,the daughter of Thomas Mostyn. After heavy rain in the morning,the afternoon was fine and dry.Many people wore period and Welsh costumes,one toured the village as a "Bidder to the Wedding"ringing his bell.The wedding party proceeded in procession to the Parish Church.As they left,they were greeted by the village fiddler and peddlar.The fiddler led the way,but at the bridge across the stream,each bride had to pay a "toll"as was the custom,to two ladies in Welsh costume, before they would proceed.The day ended with dancing and a feast.
